Creating Correlation Charts

A correlation chart is a scatter chart. To create it, you select the fields that represent the x and y-axes. The application then plots the points on the chart showing the correlation between the two axes.

The fields available on a correlation chart depend upon the fields displayed on the upper pane and whether the selected chart contains information on items.

To create a correlation chart:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Click Charts > Correlation from the component or context menu. The Correlation dialog opens.

  4. Enter a name for the chart in the Chart text box.

  5. The coordinate list boxes display the names of the fields displayed in the upper pane that can be used as axes.

    1. Select an axis label from the x-coordinate list.

    2. Select an axis label from the y-coordinate list.

  6. Do one of the following:

    • To display a chart that includes only the selected items, choose Current selection.

    • To display a chart that includes all items on the upper pane, choose Select all.

  7. Select a page orientation: Portrait or Landscape.

  8. Click OK. The chart displays.

  9. To exit the chart, click Window on the Chart menu, and select a project view.
